dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Hey everyone, welcome back to the pod! So, President-elect Joe Biden, uh, he's gearing up to be sworn in next month, which is, you know, huge news.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Hey everyone, welcome back to the pod! So, President-elect Joe Biden, uh, he's gearing up to be sworn in next month, which is, you know, huge news.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: President-elect Joe Biden is on his way to being sworn in as president next month

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, big deal, right? Finally moving forward.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, big deal, right? Finally moving forward.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. But, um, get this – he actually, like, tragically lost the Google Trends race.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. But, um, get this - he actually, like, tragically lost the Google Trends race.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: President-elect Joe Biden is on his way to being sworn in as president next month, but in the meantime hes won another honor: topping this years Google Trends, according to the tech giants Year in Search review.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wait, what? [overlaps] Lost the Google Trends race? How does that even happen? I mean, he just won the election!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, what? Lost the Google Trends race? How does that even happen? I mean, he just won the election!

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: I know, right? It's wild. So, apparently, his peak searches, uh, on Google, actually happened the week of November 1st through November 7th... in 2019. Not this year's election week.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I know, right? It's wild. So, apparently, his peak searches, uh, on Google, actually happened the week of November first through November seventh... in twenty nineteen. Not this year's election week.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: According to Google Trends, searches for Biden reached a peak the week of Nov. 1 through Nov. 7, the week the presidential election took place

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, wow. So all that buzz and, like, actual election time, and people were searching him *more* a year ago? That's kinda wild. Who *was* getting searched then?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, wow. So all that buzz and, like, actual election time, and people were searching him more a year ago? That's kinda wild. Who was getting searched then?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Well, after Biden's 2019 surge, the most searched people this year were, uh, North Korean dictator Kim Jong Un—
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, after Biden's twenty nineteen surge, the most searched people this year were, uh, North Korean dictator Kim Jong Un-
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: After Biden, the most searched people were North Korean dictator Kim Jong Un

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Kim Jong Un?! [chuckles] Are you serious?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Kim Jong Un?! Are you serious?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, particularly in April, when all those rumors about him being, like, overthrown were circulating. And then, uh, Vice President-elect Kamala Harris.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, particularly in April, when all those rumors about him being, like, overthrown were circulating. And then, uh, Vice President-elect Kamala Harris.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: particularly in April, when rumors he had died circulated—followed by Vice President-elect Kamala Harris.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, Kamala makes sense, but KJU, that's a curveball. So, where was Trump in all this, like, Google-wise?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, Kamala makes sense, but K J U, that's a curveball. So, where was Trump in all this, like, Google-wise?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Trump, um, he actually easily landed in the top 10. But get this, he wasn't even considered the most Googled person in the world in 2016, the year he, you know, *was* elected president.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Trump, um, he actually easily landed in the top ten. But get this, he wasn't even considered the most Googled person in the world in twenty sixteen, the year he, you know, was elected president.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: President Donald Trump didnt land in the top 10, though he was the most Googled person in the world in 2016, the year he was elected president.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Huh. Interesting. So Google's one thing, but what about, like, Twitter? Who was everyone tweeting about?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Huh. Interesting. So Google's one thing, but what about, like, Twitter? Who was everyone tweeting about?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Ah, Twitter's a bit different. Trump still high, but he didn't take the top spot this week for most tweeted about person of the year. Biden was right behind him, though.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Ah, Twitter's a bit different. Trump still high, but he didn't take the top spot this week for most tweeted about person of the year. Biden was right behind him, though.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: However, Trump did take the top spot this week for the most tweeted about person of the year, followed by Biden

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: And Kamala?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And Kamala?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Kamala Harris, she was, uh, the most tweeted about woman on the platform, which is pretty cool.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Kamala Harris, she was, uh, the most tweeted about woman on the platform, which is pretty cool.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: while Harris was the most tweeted about woman on the platform.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: That makes sense. She had a huge, um, year. So, what about the other side of things, like, the *least* searched keywords?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That makes sense. She had a huge, um, year. So, what about the other side of things, like, the least searched keywords?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, this is where it gets really weird. Many of the least searched phrases were, um, totally unrelated to the election, or COVID, or even Black Lives Matter.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, this is where it gets really weird. Many of the least searched phrases were, um, totally unrelated to the election, or C O V I D, or even Black Lives Matter.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Many of the most searched keywords in 2020 were phrases related to the presidential election, the coronavirus pandemic and the Black Lives Matter movement.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Really? Like what?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Really? Like what?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, number one was "election results"—but like, *unrelated* to the presidential race, which is super confusing. [overlaps] Other unpopular searches included "How to donate to Black Lives Matter," "Covid testing near me," "Elon Musk baby," and, uh, "WAP."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, number one was election results-but like, unrelated to the presidential race, which is super confusing. Other unpopular searches included How to donate to Black Lives Matter, Covid testing near me, Elon Musk baby, and, uh, W A P.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: No. 1 was election results, beating out coronavirus. Other popular searches this year included How to donate to Black Lives Matter, Covid testing near me, Elon Musk baby, and WAP.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [laughs] "WAP" was unpopular? And "election results" *not* for the presidential race? That's, like, a whole other level of internet mystery right there!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: W A P was unpopular? And election results not for the presidential race? That's, like, a whole other level of internet mystery right there!
